alert.note: Alert for Columbia (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 10:50AM EST until December 19 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of western Massachusetts, including the following county, Berkshire and east central New York, including the following counties, Columbia, Dutchess, Rensselaer and Ulster. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1048 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. Runoff may maintain some minor flood impacts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poughkeepsie, East Greenbush, Beacon, New Paltz, Hudson, Ellenville, Pawling, Chatham, Nassau, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Milton, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Claverack, Wappingers Falls, Amenia, Livingston, Copake and Stephentown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by email at ALB.stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany.
